attributes.action: put pressure on Newsquest UK Ltd to reconsider the proposed changes to its employees' final salary pension scheme
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We are calling on the Prime Minister to use his influence to help secure a better deal for members of the Newsquest final salary pension scheme. 

In order to keep the current scheme, which Newsquest claims is £65 million in deficit, the company is asking staff to increase their contribution dramatically, from six to 10 per cent over the next four years, while the company will only put in 12 per cent – far below what other comparable employers in the media sector contribute. 

At the very least Newsquest should postpone any changes to the pension scheme until it can base those changes on the results of the official valuation, which it began in April 2007. 

We also call on the company to increase its own contributions to the pension scheme to a level commensurate with those of other comparable employers, and re-open it to new members.

Newsquest UK Ltd recorded a profit of £700 million last year, and has a profit margin of some 35 per cent.

In 2003 its chief executive, Paul Davidson, earned £246,700 with a £153,000 bonus.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
